Reviews.Title: “location!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie109
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the downtown location...near Michigan avenue for shopping and close to the river. The room was small, but we were not in it that much, so it was fine. Free bottles and refills of water to grab as you head out for the day were a nice touch. We used the work out room. It was quite small and no frills, but had a treadmill and weights and that was all we wanted. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, including the maintenance man we encountered on the elevator. I'm staying there again in a few weeks and looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Less can be more if the location is right”
Reviews.Author: glofish5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Club Quarters twice. The first time the room was small and the second time the room was smaller…but we didn’t care. Both rooms were comfortable and the hotel location is extremely convenient. My husband and I took different trains into the city. I came from the airport and he came from Indiana and both of us were able to get off close to the hotel. My favorite feature is the large common room on the second floor which always has coffee available plus newspapers and magazines. We sometimes had trouble with the key access in the elevators but we managed. We got a good deal. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. In addition, it is fun to walk down State Street on Saturday night in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient, nice location, affordable”
Reviews.Author: schussles
Reviews.Content: I am a Club Quarters fan as they have made good use of limited space and keep things more affordable for those who do not have huge company expense accounts. I had a nice view on the 30th floor of the Wacker Drive property. My room was small, but I was not in it much, so no big deal. The staff was friendly. The elevator requires your key card which helped me feel safer as a woman traveling alone for work. The remote for my TV did poop out the last night of my visit, but I probably needed the extra sleep. The free wifi is a huge bonus for me. Hyatt charges $15 a day! Thanks Club Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but could be better with a little effort”
Reviews.Author: redhead8811
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club Quarters for one weekend night and overall we were very pleased with our stay. The room was small but neat and clean and seemed to have been more recently updated than the Loop location. Our room had a beautiful view of Wacker Drive, the river and the new Trump hotel. My pet peeves, the comforter was made out of some kind of synthetic material and kept slipping off the bed during the middle of the night and there was a very limited amount of towels...2 bath, 1 hand and 1 washcloth. Really? For two adults? The Loop location has complementary Aveda products in the bath but this one just had no-name shampoo/lotion and mouthwash. The staff was pleasant and friendly, even in the midst of a very busy Saturday. I would definitely recommend this hotel, I just wish they would do a little bit extra so I could give them a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: aljleal
Reviews.Content: I guess the elevator is running faster as I didn't have to wait a lot for it like in my previous visits. We do get free water, but no breakfast. free wifi around and computer and printer. Friendly, good for working and shooping

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_guy_218
Reviews.Content: Room was very small but clean and neat. Ok for the price = $110. Was told suite is much bigger. Worth the upcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel,Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: SAGAR A
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel,great views,awesome rooms,excellent facilities and wonderful staff,I am on a vacation around the USA and the minute I arrived I was well looked after by the staff and they give me all the information I needed.I would reccomend this hotel to anyone. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: disneymoon2000
Reviews.Content: There is no better stay, especially for the cost here in Chicago. I have lived in the area for over 36 years and have stayed in many hotels over the years and Club Quarters is second to none for price, location and hospitality. From the stellar views to the exceptional staff to the very comfortable rooms, I for one won't be staying anywhere else when I spend time here. Let me break it all down for you here. Location - Right in the heart of the magnificent mile. A lovely Italian restaurant at the foot of the hotel and a corner bakery right next door. You couldn't ask for better. Price - This quality and location for less than $200 a night? Again, can't beat it. Rooms - The views over the river are fantastic, spacious immaculate rooms and comfortable beds, what else do you need? Staff - The most welcoming and helpful of any hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the world. They were kind and smiling, patient and always extremely helpful. It may not have the glitz and glamour of some of the big 5 star hotels in the area, but they still beat them out with quality, comfort and kindness. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeeBranch
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and location. Staff were professional and friendly. When we arrived there was an offer of a $20 upgrade which we took and it was well worth it. The room had a fantastic view of the river and the great buildings. The room was quite large and had coffee making facilities. Downstairs was an Italian resturant which was excellent and there were other within walking distance. It is also walking distance to Michigan Ave shopping. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with exceptional view”
Reviews.Author: Adyson
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Club Quarters in Chicago. First, it has an excellent location. The restaurant downstairs with its outdoor seating is quite good (although there are so many to choose from in Chicago.) The staff was gracious, the room was a bit on the small side, but the fabulous view of the river at night overcame that. You might request the view when you check in. I liked the free bottled water feature among other amenities. I had not heard of Club Quarters before but I would stay there again when next in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters.”
Reviews.Author: jambpw
Reviews.Content: The Club Quarters at E. Wacker was great. Free wifi and in-room coffee was greatly appreciated. Price and location were OUTSTANDING!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, and a historic character.”
Reviews.Author: Freqtflyr
Reviews.Content: I love when I can find a hotel like this to stay in instead of staying at the conference hotel. That way I get a nice walk in at the beginning and end of each long session, and get to stay someplace a little more individual. The room was small, but fun to see how the designer works everything out in tighter quarters. I particularly liked the refillable water bottles and water filters in the hallway, and the mini library in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEEGEE21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway (from Minneapolis) and found the hotel to be an excellent fit for us. It is pretty reasonably priced for DT Chicago, and the rooms, while not incredibly fancy or large, serve the basic needs of people who don't plan on spending much time there anyway very well. The rooms were clean, well kept, and ours even had an excellent view of the river. One perk that I appreciated about this hotel was the availability of bottled water next to the elevators. The single greatest part of staying here is the location. It is right next door to all of the shopping and restaurants in the Mich. Ave. area, and very walkable to millenium park / the field museum. Seriously could have not picked a better spot to stay. Perfect for a younger couple that doesn't want to break the bank, who wanted to be out in the city most of their stay, and just needed a clean, good room to come to after the night out.

Reviews.Title: “great hidden gem in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BMIFlyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times as my business puts me at a meeting just down the street a couple of times a year. This is really a great hotel. The first and second floor lobby area's are nicely decorates. The location can't be beat (right on the river), and you pay 30% less then most comparable hotels in the area. Even parking at $25 garage and $35 valet is less then the general area. The rooms, while nicely furnished, can be very small. This is not a big deal for a single traveler like me, but if traveling with a spouse or kids, be sure to upgrade to a larger room. I love having the tower rooms with the curved walls and the great view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: amtraveler77
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for a 4 night stay and the hotel was perfectly located. Everything you want to see in the downtown is a 20 min walk or less, the L is 5 min away, the river is right out the front door. Free water bottles on each floor was a nice perk which we took on our many sightseeing tours during the day. The rooms were small but well kept and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. We'd stay again in a minute...it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, super affordable, and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: AnneSt_Paul_MN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here when we combined a visit to family with our anniversary. We aren't people who spend a lot of time in our room, but would like a comfy bed and clean bathroom when we want a break from exploring a city. Club Quarters far exceeded our expectations. The rooms were bigger than expected, the views were great, and the location was more than we could hope for. It was so nice to be in the heart of the city right when we walked out the door. We actually commented on how we felt bad for those spending 4 times as much on a room across the river, when we had the same distance to everything and the same view! In addition, parking was a breeze (and reasonable when parking for 24 hours) and it is convienent to the trains. We will happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the hotel could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: winemaker23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Chicago for three nights at Club Quarters Wacker. The buliding is beautiful (one of the oldest skyscrapers and right on the river) and staff are friendly however we were given a room on one of the higher floors and it was like an oven. We asked it the air con could be turned on and were told that it could either act as a heater or a blower (i.e., no chiller). We asked to move rooms and were given keys to the adjoining River Hotel which is part of the same hotel group. The new room was still warm but we could open the windows and the room was more modern and more spacious. One small incident where I broke a drinking glass which left tiny shards on the floor. I left a note for Housekeeping asking for the floor to be vacuumed and this wasn't done resulting in me cutting my foot on a glass splinter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at CQ, the first time was at the Adams location. Even though this location was a bit pricier, it was worth it for the great location. Though the rooms are small and no frills, ours had a great river view as well as a fridge and microwave. It's very close to a 7/11 , many restaurants and activities. The only reason I gave it four stars is that I found the bed to be uncomfortable and the sheets stiff. It would not deter me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ms.verdone
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel and we found this a great place to stay for our weekend away in Chicago. Great proximity to so many of the wonderful Chicago sights. Very reasonably priced and our studio room was super comfy, clean, quiet and spacious. The restaurant, Bella Bacinos, had very good food and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, just a bed really.”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian1
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed at teh Club Quarters at Wacker and Michigan in downtown Chicago a few times. Mostly we keep going back because of the prime location and decent rates. Parking is a bit steep at $35 a day, but what do you expect in downtown Chicago? The rooms are small, but clean. We have only gotten a standard room and the rate is between $189-$205 during the week and we got a $139 rate on the weekend. We had a weird triangle shaped room this last time, but again, you can't beat the location. Other hotels right there (literally connected) is the River Hotel, and Hotel 71 is on the same block. This place looked very cool and I wanted to stay there but the rates were almost $100 more per night. We only spent time in the room to sleep and get ready in the morning thus it is doable.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ErinDwyer
Reviews.Content: Traveling on my own, so the small size of the room was no problem. I think it might have been a squeeze if I had two people staying in the Standard room. Bed was super comfortable. The free water bottles are a cool feature. Location is fabulous and everyone was so friendly. The lobby is gorgeous too! One complaint: TV did not have PBS. What????

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sammsays
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise this hotel was. The staff were nice and professional the suite that we stayed in was furnished with everything we could need or want. The housekeeping was mostly good, a few missed cleaning spots, nothing big though. Our only complaint is the "king" bed was two twin beds put together, very uncomfortable. All in all and wonderful three night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Filtered water, tiny and too-hot rooms”
Reviews.Author: JustGetOnTheTrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters for 4 nights in mid-September while attending a conference up the street at the Hyatt. The price was decent, about $164+ per night, but the "Clubsize" rooms are small - only about 8 feet wide - although long enough for a bed, desk, closet and bathroom (with shower - no bathtub - the room is too narrow). My room had a coffeemaker, microwave, and mini-fridge, but I had to call the front desk to ask for an iron & ironing board (and a luggage rack). There are filtered water dispensers (free) and racks of plastic bottles in the elevator lobby on several floors, as well as in the 2nd floor club living room - a nice touch, one I'd never seen before in a hotel. My biggest problem was that I could never get the temperature in the room below 75 deg. I asked at the front desk on day 2 and they said they were "changing some rooms over from air conditioning to heat." Since the windows on the 22nd floor don't open, I had no option but to swelter, since I'd already unpacked and settled in and didn't want the hassle of having to move rooms. I did see a sign when i checked in saying "suite upgrades available tonight, as low as $10" and I should have looked into it, but didn't. Great location, right on the river across from Trump Tower. The shrimp risotto at Bella Bacina is very good, and Houlihan's next door has a wonderful small-plates menu (pot roast sliders, yum). Club Quarters is okay if the price is right and you don't mind somewhat cramped quarters.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: FishhookIndiana
Reviews.Content: This was simply a great place to stay. My room was spotless, comfortable, stylish, well appointed and...the endless, free purified bottled water is a sweet touch. Italian restaurant in lobby good. Location can't be beat. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Small and worth the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: tlc69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights. The first two in a very small room--two people would have overcrowded it. But, they warn you about the size in advance. For $20, I upgraded to a room with a sleeping alcove, siting space, and a kitchen area. That would have been fine for two people. The key cards didn't seem to work about a third of the time. That was annoying but the staff was helpful in correcting things. Location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: bongo330
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago for a wedding and stayed at the Club Quarters in a standard room for two nights. The room was small, but laid out nicely and was within walking distance to everywhere we needed to be. Enjoyed our stay in Chicago so much we decided to stay an extra night so we booked a club size room at The River (same building). This room was also clean, compact and comfortable. I stayed at The River hotel in May with two friends and we had a two bedroom, two bathroom suite which was amazing! The location of this hotel is a plus for shopping on Michigan Avenue or exploring the area.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: mirandabader
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very small and the rooms were painfully small. The bed had to be pushed all the way against one wall and you could barely turn around in the bathroom. BUT, the location was excellent, there was unlimited, free bottled water, and the rooms were clean. If all you want is a place to sleep in a great location, the price here is right. Also, the pizza place downstairs, Bella Baccino's, is my very favorite. It was kind of a nice coincidence that it shared a building with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best location , great price for the thick of thnings”
Reviews.Author: lawchicago2850
Reviews.Content: Club quarters is a great buy . Rooms are clean and very modern. more a business trade decor but the locations cannot be beat when considering price .Right on the river overlooking Michigan Ave. Bridge . Italian resturant in the lobby is fantsatic . I have stayed in CQ in NYC and London cant pass them up

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Nice Rooms, Beware of 2nd floor!”
Reviews.Author: bcerbelli
Reviews.Content: We booked this online several months before our trip and got a great rate. Catering to business you seem to get a better deal on the weekends at any Club Quarters. This one is the perfect location on Wacker and 1 block from Michigan Ave. The hotel is very nice. We had an easy checkin and were even offered an upgrade to a studio room with lake view for $20 more a night. We took it. They gave us a room on the 2nd floor, which was nice for the fact that it was the only floor you could walk to and not have to wait for the elevator. The room was nice and roomy. It came with a queen bed, couch/bed desk, 19: Flat screen TV, mini refrigerator and microwave. The bathroom was a good size, especially the shower. Nicely done in tile with a removeable shower head. The view on the otherhand was not of the river. While we were facing the river, we were too low to actually see it since it dips down below street level. We decide to keep it the room as the view of the rest of the city was a good one. On the 2nd floor they have free coffee and purified water all day. Couches and a tv to hang out by and 2 computers free of charge to surf the net and print out your airline tickets. The first floor had an Italian restaurant attached to it with a very nice patio, but didnt partake. There are many other less expensive restaurants close by. The only downside of our stay was the 2nd floor room had a huge flag outside of the window, This did not impede our view but whenever the wind blew it banged the metal clasps against the metal pole and kept us up all night! We complained but they said they couldnt do anything with the flag. They did give us a future free night at any Club Quarters though. So, in summary, great location and value, but stay on a high floor to see the river and avoid the flag banging.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: jbp19
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Club Quarters Wacker at Michigan for three nights while I attended a conference a few blocks away. The location is good, right on the river, and across from the Trump Tower and Wrigley Building. It's within walking distance of public transport/el, and the price is extremely reasonable for the area. While the price was great, my room was pretty small--not really a problem since I was busy outside of the hotel during most of my visit. I was expecting the room to be small anyway since I've stayed at other Club Quarters hotels and have had similar sized rooms, but nothing this tiny. I couldn't have the bathroom door (which opened out) and the closet door open at the same time. That said, the view from my room (32nd floor) was great. The hotel/lobby area is kind of awkward since it shares space with the River Hotel. Make sure you get on the correct elevator since there are separate sets for each hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Greaton location”
Reviews.Author: DJC1968
Reviews.Content: You would be hard-pressed to find a cheaper, cleaner hotel in a better location. Located right near the beginning of the Magnificent mile, and a short walk to the Navy Pier, the hotel's room are clean and if you're lucky, you could get one with a great view of the Chicago River. Parking garage is located closeby, on the south side of Wacker avenue, just east of Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: j j
Reviews.Content: Before I start my rant I would just like to say I have stayed in quite a few hotels, including 5 star and 1 star hotels. This hotel claims to be a 3 star. At check in we "upgraded" our room for $20 for a pathetic excuse of a hotel room. I cannot imagine how small the normal rooms are because our upgrade was tiny and on the third floor. For comparison, I have stayed at the Holiday Inn in the city and had a huge and much cleaner room for a cheaper price. Anyways, on our way to our room we noticed that we were now staying at the River Hotel, instead of the Club Quarters. For the record we had booked a room at the Club Quarters. I guess they put their guests wherever they want depending on room availability. While settling in I managed to find that our towels were shredded, there was mold coming out of our vent and we had blood on our sheets. We called concierge asking for new sheets. They apologized but the man that came to change them said it looks like oil but we will change your sheets anyway. Whatever the hotel decides to think the stain is there is no excuse for dirty sheets in a hotel. At check out we got our bill and immediately noticed that they had charged us for a late checkout. Checkout is at 12 and after waiting in line it was 11:55. The hotels time stamp was set about 40 minutes in advanced and was charging everyone that was checking out a late checkout fee of about $40. Save your money and do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Touring Chicago”
Reviews.Author: IrdyBirdy
Reviews.Content: I finally registered on Trip Advisor just so I could say how much we liked this hotel. The room was spotless and the location can't be beat. We happened to have a view of the river, Trump Tower*, and the Wrigley and Tribune buildings. (*The Trump Tower, being itself a mirror, provides additional views to the south.) A problem with one of the elevators upon arrival was completely resolved by the time we got back from lunch, and even that wouldn't have mattered if our room hadn't been ready before noon (a nice bonus). Check-in consisted of a credit card swipe. We never tried the restaurant on the premises but the aromas were good and the place was always packed.

Reviews.Title: “NOT FOR ME”
Reviews.Author: brennyjd
Reviews.Content: I was totally disappointed with this property. i didn't expect elegance; but I, certainly, did not expect a college dorm room. That is what you get in the standard queen room. The reviews I read on the property did not adequately prepare me for the reality. Upon check-in, upgrades--starting at $20/night---are advertised. Understandably! The standard queen is a tiny, bare bones room. I have never stayed in anything quite like this---and, definitely, not for the price I paid. Fortunately, I was here for only one night. The only plus for me was free internet access. If you need to stay in this area and chose this hotel, UPGRADE, UPGRADE, UPGRADE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Calliope83
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for Lollapalooza and it was in such a great location close to many attractions. We were able to walk wherever we wanted and the parking garage was close as well as much cheaper than many others. Our first night we were in a suite and WOW! But when we had to go back to our original room it was very nice as well. All staff was helpful and there were no issues even with our late check in. For the location the price was also affordable. Our only complaint was the overly firm beds. All in all, we'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Betty B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely clean, the staff was exceptional I would recommend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki036
Reviews.Content: I think I found the best boutique hotel in Chicago! This small, quaint hotel is top notch. The staff is very friendly and courteous. The rooms are ultra clean! I rented a mini-room which was perfect for one person. They have regular sized rooms too. The location is perfect, you are right on the river with wonderful restaurant and shopping within walking distance. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “amazing view and location at city center”
Reviews.Author: bertugrul
Reviews.Content: It has the wonderful scene of skyscrapers in Chicago. The room is professionally designed to use relatively smaller space in an effective way. All necessary equipment and devices are available in the room. It is especially amazing to see the view of the skyscrapers when it is cloudy since it is hardy impossible to see the top of them. For much space, you can prefer suits. Since it has close parking space, it is not a problem to go there by your car. 35$ per day is enough to get this service. Its location provides you with the opportunity to explore the city whenever you want. In brief, it would be a good alternative for the ones who want to be at a close proximity to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jenslish
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a couple of colleagues while we were visiting Chicago for a conference. We selected this hotel for a couple of reasons; 1. free wireless, 2. location (close enough to the conference hotel, L station, shopping, etc) 3. price. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The restaurant attached to the hotel was always hopping, though we didn't eat there. We opted for the Corner Bakery a few steps away for our breakfast each morning. The hotel is just a half block off of Michigan Avenue and within walking distance of so many things. Since it was so hot during our visit, we saved quite a bit of money with the free bottled water in the hotel! The hotel staff was pleasant and quick to help. Extra towels arrived to our rooms within minutes of calling. The hotel rooms are small, but the view of the river was fantastic. When you need a clean and safe place to sleep, this fits the bill. Free wifi was very strong and we had no problems connecting, even on the 17th floor. The business center was small, but had a couple of computers and a printer, not crowded, ever. My only complaint is that the sheets were very stiff and harsh. But, all things considered, the other amenities made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: tcuckt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip and it was close to the office and major Chicago attractions. My room was small but sufficient for business travel. Front desk staff very helpful - clean rooms - okay fitness center. Close to major intersections so a bit nosy but overall, not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: kenno72
Reviews.Content: Clean, small room. Great view. Uncomfortable twin bed with average linens. The elevators were painfully slow also. However a great location on the River. Breakfast easy to get at the Corner Bakery, however try to get in early to avoid long lines on the weekends

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rate”
Reviews.Author: Reactor1966
Reviews.Content: We do a lot of corporate business with this hotel, which probably had a lot to do with the rate, but the rate I got was significantly lower than other hotels. Something was amiss with my room during checkin, so they upgraded me to a "suite". Now for anyone that has stayed at Club Quarters and knows the size of the rooms the term "suite" is kind of laughable - it's about the same size as a normal room in other hotels. But the CQ continues to be a very clean and convenient hotel for business stays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NatsDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in a studio suite. Excellent location, lovely clean rooms and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: melissa6alice
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! Parking wasn't a bad price and the room was big. I made sure to get one of the bigger rooms when booking because I was traveling with a one year old. I booked the one room suite with kitchenette. It had a king bed and a pull out couch. The kitchenette had a stove top, a toaster, a microwave, a fridge, and dishes! Perfect when traveling with a young one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, if small hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: MKB1701
Reviews.Content: I was delighted to book at this hotel based upon what I had heard from my friend who has stayed at most of the better hotels in Chicago. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating, and it's clear that this is a very well-run hotel. Yet, there are some details that left me wanting. The rooms, as many other reviewers have stated, are tiny. Mind you, they're clean, well-appointed rooms. But tiny. Also, on the Club Quarters side, there are only two elevators for approximately 20 or so floors, which makes getting up and down from your room a long process. Even worse, there is no service elevator, so the cleaning staff is using the same elevators as everyone else during check-out time. It took us nearly 15 minutes to get down one time! Aside from these flaws, the hotel met our needs nicely. The view of the Chicago business district and the river are splendid, and there's a 7-11 and several excellent restaurants within a 5 minute amble should you want to eat. For a short trip, Club Quarters is a good choice for lodging in central Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PolarYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We got transferred here fromthe Central loop location as there had been a flood. The staff were very helpful, sorting a taxi etc to aid in the transfer. Once at the Wacker location, check-in was simple and quick and after a slight hiccup with the lift we got to our room overlooking the river. The room was clean and tidy with all the mod cons that you need. The bathroom was compact and clean. Overall, the location is fabulous and the hotel very good. The laundry was an adventure but a useful bonus as it's free!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location/ Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SeeSawSay
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It is an excellent location just across the river from the much more expensive mega hotels. This smaller boutique hotel has smallish rooms and is merely a nicely furnished, liveable scale place. It has the advantage of being near breakfast shops and convenience stores but also close to the Trump Hotel and Sheraton, Hyatt and Hilton for the conventions that regularly use Chicago's Magnificent Mile neighborhood shopping and energy for clients and convention parties. This small hotel is built in an older office building. Rooms are in the heart of Chicago and close to everything. The check in was fast and efficient, check out was great and service was handled well. Overall, great value and highly professional stay for business or leisure on a getaway. Go elsewhere if you want more space or better views, or have ideas of a vacation for coupes or kids. This is a fine place for a quick visit or simple business. great meeting rooms and internet access with printing and conference facilities. Great value and superb location.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT AND WILL BE BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandyWindsor_Canada
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in JUne 2011. It was the best location ever! I keep recommeding it to everyone. I did not find the rooms that small as i've seen posted. The hotel staff were very curtious and friendly and willing to help with anything. Especially Wells!The room was very clean. You can walk to everything if you don't want to, there are cabs right outside. The loop trains are very efficient and clean as well We were quite impressed with how clean the city was and recommend it to everyone! We will be back, and i would love to stay at club quarters wacker and michigan!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, so so service”
Reviews.Author: OtherJFK
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for business and sight-seeing. The rooms are small, which I expected. The price was cheap, so I really have nothing to complain about. The restaurant off the lobby is good, reasonably priced and the service is great. All of the staff in the restaurant are very friendly. The hotel is very tall and narrow. That means that with only two elevators you can sometimes wait for a very long time and then have the elevator doors open to find there is no room. It was not unusual for the wait to be 5 to 10 minutes. The worst part of this stay was trying to retrieve the luggage I stored on my last day. It took 25 minutes for them to bring it out and by then I was worried about getting to the airport on time. When that's the last impression you get of a hotel, you're not likely to return to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Kayo55
Reviews.Content: Club Qtrs is a great place. First class all the way. The check in is seemless, the people are friendly and the overall quality is outstanding. They have done a marvelous job in design and construction..Will stay here and in their Boston location every opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gowithmykids
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place with a great location. It was easy to use the train and bus to get there and get around the city. It is also very close to the water taxi. If you are looking for a room for 3, don't trust the web site. We booked a suite online and when we got there the room we had reserved did not accommodate 3 adults. The staff were friendly and helpful so within 5 minutes we had a different room that worked out fine. If you get a room on the 2 floors - in the tower - you will have to use stairs for the last flight or two. But I was told the view is worth it. Skip the restaurant that is in the hotel- the food was awful.

Reviews.Title: “great location, not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Champaign_travels
Reviews.Content: It is at a very convenient place, price is very good for the area, and very reasonable parking (for Chicago). However, the room was very small and hotel did not seem serviced well. We asked for extra pillows, they only had one in the whole hotel (they claimed). We called to tell them that toilet was turning on and off, but they did not have anyone to fix it at night (OK, I guess). We went to bed early, exhausted from travel and sightseeing on hot day. I woke up at 1:30 a.m. to bright message light on phone blinking -- bit of panic but when I checked the message, it had been posted at 10:40 p.m. about what to do if we wanted to check bags the next day (we did not). If I could not find another place, I would stay again, but I think I will try other places first.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location ! !”
Reviews.Author: 007NewYorker
Reviews.Content: I took the red eye flight from New York, but when I arrived at the hotel I had issues with my reservation. For some reason it was not showing in their systems, and of courcse this was not what I wanted to hear so early in the morning. The gentleman in the front desk was truly that, a gentleman. Andreas, saw my frustration, and immediately started working on getting me a room for the same rate I had reserved it. He not only quickly solved this problem for me but actually gave me an upgrade to a suite, this made my stayed even better. Even thou I was not the most pleasant guess to deal with at that time, Andreas maintain his calm, he was very polite, he has excellent customer service skills that shows his professionalism and it speaks great of this hotel. If you are ever in Chicago, I recommend this hotel because of the location, price and the excellent customer service everyone there provides, but also because their wife is very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: PhilUSA2010
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at Club Quarters Wacker at Michigan. This hotel was one of the best I stayed in in the USA and topped off a great time in Chicago. It is easy walking distance to Sears (Willis) Tower, John Hancock Tower, Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, Fountain, Lakeshore. Chicago River boats are literally across the street! The room was exceptionally well appointed and clean - I could see the Chicago River out the window. Business Centre great, bottles of water on each floor appreciated. Absolutely recommend anyone stay here - parking is extra (about $20 per day with hotel validation) - garage is a short walk up the road.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place To Stay Inexpensively In The Loop”
Reviews.Author: FishLoverDave
Reviews.Content: I'm a medical professional and I was attending a conference being held in the Hyatt Regency and wanted a cheap sleep within an easy walk and this place fit the bill. It's maybe a 3 minute walk to the Hyatt where my conference was being held. This was my first stay at a Club Quarters hotel which apparently is a chain of like 14 value-oriented hotels in big cities catering to the business crowd. Anyone can stay at a Club Quarters, but their marketing gimmick is that if you're a member of an affiliated organization, you get a cheaper rate. It turns out, I'm a member of one of their affiliated organizations but was unable to get the cheaper rate either on-line, via phone when I made my reservation, or in person when I showed up. There were different excuses as to why I couldn't make reservations at the affiliated member rate, but I think the 'cheap rate for members' might be more marketing fluff than any real savings. Nevertheless, at ~$130/night + 15% taxes it was a far sight cheaper than the Hyatt. The place is right across from Trump Tower and is close to everything in the loop. Scores or restaurants are within easy walking distance. You couldn't ask for a better location. The building is a high-rise, and the first 10 floors or so are offices or condos I think, with the hotel above that, and they put me on the 38th floor, which I think is the highest floor for regular hotel use. Despite the height, the view wasn't that good since other high rises pretty much surround this building blocking most of the view. I was facing South and could see a small amount of distant South Chicago like McCormick place and the South lakeshore. The room was itty-bitty but adequate. Let me say that in a different way: this is among the smallest hotel rooms I ever stayed in. It was OK for one person but I think a couple would find it oppressively small. Nevertheless it had everything I needed: a firm mattress on the bed, a desk where I could work, fast free wireless internet, and an OK bathroom (shower only). There's no air conditioning in this building, and there's a fan which blew right on me, which I find objectionable so I didn't use it. Opening the window, which is possible, resulted in a hurricane of wind blowing into the room from around the door jamb from the hallway and sounded like a tornado, so I just left the fan off and the windows closed. Fortunately it was cool weather but in July it might be problematic. There was also a high level of street noise when I opened the window, objectionable even from the 38th floor. There was a report of bed bugs from this place, so the first thing I did was tear the bed apart when I walked in the room, and using my high-intensity "LED mag light" I saw no evidence of the critters. I would note that some hotels zip the entire mattress into a cotton cloak that can't be opened but they don't do that here. At least for now, and at least in my room, you're safe. The bathroom was small but adequate. There is barely room for your toiletries. The room was oddly shaped, not rectangular, and the desk squeezed into the corner of a triangle if you catch my drift, and the chair kept banging into the wall which you could tell had happened before as the wall was all punched-in at chair height. There's a flat screen TV mounted above the desk, on a swivel so you could watch from the bed if so inclined, or by sitting at the desk but you're pretty close if you do that. I didn't use the cordless phone but they do have 2 phones in the room, a cordless and a regular wired phone. The "direct dial" number listed on the phone is actually for some sort of conference center, and people who tired to get me at that number were confused. Better to have people call you at the front desk and have them connect your caller. You need your room key to ride the elevator here, by putting it in the slot and you then have about 15 seconds for the people on the elevator to punch their floors. Seems like good security but any intruder could get on the elevator and punch in a floor like any guest. Sort of gimmicky. The housekeeping was a little spotty. They didn't replenish my toiletries during the entire week I was there, and I had to ask for soap when the last sliver became microscopic, but did provide me with new bar of soap lickity-split. Housekeeping left my door open one day. It just didn't latch properly and theoretically my stuff in the room was at risk of theft. They didn't remove the coffee filter out of the in-room coffee maker one day, which was no big deal for me to do but that's what housekeeping is supposed to be doing. There's a mezzanine on the second floor where they have coffee most of the day, and apples. Nice touch. They also have water dispensers and empty pop bottles on most floors (not mine) but seems like a gimmick too. You can drink Chicago water right out of the tap, which is where I suspect the water comes from anyway, and you don't know if they washed the re-usable pop bottle since the last guy either. They have a business center with a couple of fast computers, and a printer you can use at no expense. I was delighted that the computers were configured so that none of your passwords or usernames get saved once you log out, as best as I could tell. It was nice to be able to print a few items. Kudos to them, based on my experience at other business centers I've used recently. I never got to use the exercise facility so I can't comment. There is an Italian restaurant associated with the hotel but there are literally dozens of places within a 10 minute walk or less you don't have to eat there, and there are also reasonably priced eats (for Chicago) like Corner Bakery and Cafe right next door to the hotel, open until 7:00 so you could even get a fast dinner there if you were rushed. They opened early for breakfast too, at 6:30 AM. All-in-all, a perfectly adequate place to stay. It has everything you need and at a good price for the location. I'd stay here again, but maybe not in hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “They are in the business of taking care of people!”
Reviews.Author: capricorn6872
Reviews.Content: My trip was beyond superb. I stayed for a week and was given exceptional service the moment I walked in the door by Tom Haselberger and several other staff members. I felt like I was the most important guest in the hotel. I usually stay at the Hyatt Regency when traveling on business but I am so glad that they were booked this trip to beautiful Chicago. My room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. A+ hotel thanks mostly in part to the professional and caring staff!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal customer service”
Reviews.Author: NVbeachfan
Reviews.Content: Ended up here after check-in mix up at Club Quarters Central Loop. Checked in after midnight Sunday morning, and had to leave at 7 am. They discounted our room, and the valet pointed out the free parking spaces across the street so we saved on parking as well. He didn't have to do that but he could see we were exhausted from the mix up at the other CQ. Only issue was we could hear the sirens, but hey, we had a river view room and just wish we could have stayed longer. VERY accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for 1st time visit!”
Reviews.Author: jozd5150
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Chicago, we found Club Quarters to be the perfect location. It was within walking distance to the places we wanted to see: Millenium Park, Navy Pier, Mag Mile, Willis (Sears) Tower, and so much more. Easy access to the River Walk. Sure, the room was small but we didn't need or want an overpriced, palatial space (who spends much time in a hotel room, anyway?) We even got a river view room. For the price, we almost expected shabby, worn down accommodations but everything was clean, modern, and well kept. Loved the amenities and services available to members. Hotel staff was friendly and attentive. The restaurant, Bella Bacino's, attached to Club Quarters was convenient and welcoming. Our first night there, we stopped in for a couple drinks and were greeted and treated like old friends. On another night, we met a couple friends there for dinner, and the food was superb. We will definitely make this our home base whenever we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: kthmathews
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago and I lucked out by finding Club Quarters on Wacker. The receptionist first asked if I was by myself as the room I had booked was one of their smaller one and she wanted to make sure I would have enough room if I was traveling with someone. Yes, the room was small, but it was lovely and clean with a view of the river. All of the staff that I had contact with was friendly and helpful. They asked if I needed wakeup calls, taxis or anything to make my visit more pleasant. The lobby area is a nice size with computers guests can use to print airline boarding passes. The hotel restaurant is reasonably priced, has great food, and a friendly staff. The location is great -- next to shopping, the theatre district and the Art Institute. My husband and I will be returning in May and, again in June.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding choice!”
Reviews.Author: AlanKWi
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, very helpful and friendly staff, small but very clean and very comfortable room. Great price too. If you need a cozy place to do work there is a nice area for that downstairs too with free internet access. The adjacent restaurant is also very good. I found this on tripadvisor and found the overall very good reviews to be spot-on and well deserved..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: jt_powell
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel for a large radiology conference. It offers friendly service and a comfortable room at great location. The view from my room, overlooking the river and Michigan avenue was beautiful at night. Get off your plane, take the blue line downtown and its a short walk to the hotel. In my case, the conference buses stop at the hotel next door and the Millenium Metra station is just three blocks away. I highly recommend as a home base for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Good price”
Reviews.Author: TaherAlbaghliJulian
Reviews.Content: i like river view ,location, very clean hotel , very good price i miss swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ... Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorndogCorndog
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline.com and bid for a hotel. I won the bid for a reasonable rate. The location is excellent, right on the corner of Michigan and Wacker. It is easy to get to the Magnificient Mile and the Theatre District. As for the hotel, it was average at best. The standard room is very small with no dresser. Hotel is showing wear and tear. The restaurant/bar closes early 10pm on weekdays and 11pm on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: kdfrench
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the price and location of this hotel if you want to be in the heart of downtown Chicago. We were a short walk from the Water Tower/Magnificent Mile area and a short walk from the State Street shopping (cite of the former Marshall Field's store). The room we had was not large, but it was nicely furnished and clean. One perk was a water cooler by the elevator of every floor where you can have free bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done, but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: 042111b
Reviews.Content: The room I booked was small and spare, nothing exciting. But I slept well, which is what counts most in the end, right?

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: pitufo00
Reviews.Content: After spending two horrible nights at the Travelodge, we moved to the Club Quarters. This hotel cost us little over twice as much per night as the TL, but it was worth it. The room was large and clean and comfortable. Sheets were clean and crisp. The staff was attentive and helpful. They offered little things, like free water bottles. Restaurant downstairs was decent. So close to so many things, easy to walk to many main attractions. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “At last - a nice, affordable downtown Chicago hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KCKemp
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Club Quarters at Wacker & Michigan and found it to be a very good alternative to the other much higher priced hotels in the area. The location is excellent; very close to the Magnificent Mile and to the theater district. Check in and check out were both easy and painless with their automated system. I was in my room literally just 2 minuttes after I walked through the front door. My room was small but clean and nicely decorated. The only negative I had was that the hotel wireless service wasn't strong enough to make it to my room on the 36th floor. But there was plenty of space on the 2nd floor Club Room to spread out, hook up a laptop and print off boarding passes. All in all, if you want a clean, affordable hotel in the center of downtown Chicago, this is the place to be. I'll definitely return to this hotel for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive alternative to nearby convention hotels”
Reviews.Author: aversetospam
Reviews.Content: If you are attending a convention at the usual hotels in the loop or near the Navy Pier,then the Club Quarters provides an economical alternative. The Fairmont, the Hyatt Regency, the Palmer House and other convention hotels offer on-premises-convenience and larger rooms at a premium price. Club Quarters offers low room rates, with no charges for myriad smaller items that nibble away at budgets. The free internet, free bottled water, free printing and other goodies plus the lower rates add up to substantial savings. This comes at the price of small but functional rooms, views through tiny windows and comfortable but limited lobby / sitting spaces. Hint: If coming from Ohare, take the CTA Blue Line to the Lake Station and walk to the hotel. The CTA is always cheaper and often faster than using a taxi or shuttle service. Hint: For really good food, leave the Loop and head out to the neighborhoods. Seek the advice of Chicago friends or the concierge. Hint: Different booking sites offered substantially different rates for the same nights and class of rooms at this property. Check around a bit before booking. Hint: Do not count on the free printing to work. I was not able to pick up my boarding pass because of a malfunction.

Reviews.Title: “A wretched hotel with worse service”
Reviews.Author: Mikenmar22000
Reviews.Content: We booked through a name you own price deal and got this hotel. It proved very difficult to get to because of the filming that closed the block this hotel is on and several others around it.. We had to park blocks away because we got no help from the hotel staff who's answer was to park and take a cab. When we got there, the fron desk was rude and slow. The room was awful. It was the most unsanitary room I've seen in years. There were spots of what appeared to be blood on one of the pillowcases, spots on the floor near the toilet, muck on the windows, a couple of big dried on hairs on the wall in the shower and the flourescent light in the hotel room was flickering like a bug zapper. Additionally the room was insanely loud as the walls are very thin and there was filming going on outside of a movie with simulated gunfire and explosions less than a block away. A call to the front desk brought a promise of maintenance and housekeeping but no delivery. When we called the company we booked through they said it was up to the hotel if we could receive a cancel or rebook and the hotel refused and they stated that the hotel had stated that filming had concluded. So to sum up, the hotel is poorly staffed with unresponsive employees, the room was filthy, and the entire place was a nightmare to even get to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful July 4th experience in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteKC
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotwire w/ their Hotels.com connection (could see the hotel in advance and can cancel). The location is fantastic (on the river between Michigan and Wabash). At check in the service was awesome!! So friendly and helpful. Our room (remember we booked thru Hotwire) was on the 21st floor overlooking the river - great view. The hotel has free wifi and a service where you can print from your room or they have computers (and printers) for use in a couple of areas. They provide chilled bottled water on each floor, free self-service laundry (including the soap & softner) and on the second floor a "club" area. The bar and restaurant are nice and you can eat outside. We had a drink at the bar, but did not eat at the restaurant. I will absolutely stay here again!! Especailly if I can get it for $111.00

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ArbCreative
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. We were right downtown with easy access to restaurants, cabs, public transportation and attractions. Right outside the door was the Chicago Riverwalk, offering several dining options, as well as other options on Wacker in either direction. The room was on the small side, but perfect for my husband and I, with a comfortable bed, walk-in shower, view overlooking the river and desk with free wi-fi and printing right from the room to the printer in the lobby. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the elevators are secured with room key access. For a little over $100/night, this hotel can't be beat for it's central location, pleasant room and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: marisuz28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location for walking to Michigan Ave for shopping, restaurants, and is not that far of a walk from Navy Pier. You can walk to most of the great tourist destinations from here, or just hop in for a short cab ride. It's also only about a 10 minute walk from the blue and orange line CTA trains! They offer free bottled water on every floor, and the rooms are very clean. The bed was very comfortable, but they could really stand to have an extra blanket on the beds (they only have a sheet and comforter). They had a nice desk in the room, and a newer flat screen TV. They also have free WiFi, which is wonderful! The only real negative to me was the size of the room. Since this is a boutique hotel, the regular rooms tend to be really small. I felt like my husband and I were stumbling over each other constantly! Other than that, I think this was a really nice hotel at a great value in downtown Chicago. I would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Central location to the sights”
Reviews.Author: travelerlpl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a member hotel. It is located right across from the river where you can easily reach tour boats and trolleys. Chicago has wonderful architectural buildings, old and new. This is an older hotel with nice architecture and right across from the Trump Towers. The front desk was very helpful and courteous. An italian restaurant is located there also with outside tables and you feel like you are sitting outside in a european cafe seeing all the older ornate buildings around you. The rooms, however, are very small (at least the two I saw). I first wanted to get a "river view" room and was informed the only room is a double bed, so I took it since I was a solo traveler. I walked in the room and that's all that was in there! No desk, no chair, just a bed and a tiny window that you couldn't get to, to look out!! So I asked for the queen bed, which was still small, but had a desk (where I had to put my suitcase) and a much larger window facing the city. There was free internet access also. There is also a flat screen TV in the room. The bathroom had a shower only, but that was fine for me. At the elevator, there are water bottles that you can fill with filtered cold water at any time for free. There is a club room available with coffee & tea available along with couches and chairs, and business center. All in all, a nice little hotels with not alot of frills, but location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: jalola
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week in a single room. Bed was comfortable. I had all the conveniences I needed. Everything looked well-kept. Even had complimentary filtered water available on each floor. The location is as convenient as you can get in Chicago, being less than 10 minutes' walk from both the magnificent mile and the stores on State Street in the Loop. I stayed from Sunday to Thursday and it was quiet. Did get walked in on by a housekeeper who entered without knocking. That was the only surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms, good value!”
Reviews.Author: canamtraveller007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, clean and a great value. We stayed for two nights, and would suggest asking for a river-facing view - it's worth it! Although our request couldn't be accommodated on the first night of our stay (the hotel was fully booked and we returned to check in late in the evening), the hotel was willing to move us to a river-facing room for the second night to fulfill our request. Overall, we found the hotel staff to be very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay here again and would suggest our friends and family do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: neon645
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. It's close to shops, restaurants, bars, famous sites and is right in front of the Chicago River. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful, VERY nice rooms and the rates are amazing for the area. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat! No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: missmclevans
Reviews.Content: I wasn't quite sure what we were getting ourselves into -- we booked this by bidding on priceline, so we didn't know what it was until we got the confirmation. Great price, so we were a little skeptical. The only review we saw on tripadvisor was about it being good for the business traveller. BUT I would say it would be just fine for any couple looking for a nice hotel in Chicago. This hotel is in a beautiful building -- they actually pointed the building out on an architecture tour we did. Amazing location, right on the south side of the river. Beautiful views. The room was super clean and everything felt new or very well maintained. The bed was heavenly. We had a blast. The hotel staff were so, so helpful and friendly, and were more than willing to give us recommendations for things to do in the area. Overall, fantastic experience. Hotel location was perfect. Super close to a bunch of loop subway stations so we never had to walk too far to catch the right train. It's right across the river from the Trump Tower and we could see the Marina City buildings from our window. Such a nice view. We heard that the area was quite dead at night but there were actually a bunch of bars and restaurants just north of the river, just across the bridge. It wasn't really our scene (pretty fratty) but if we didn't want to travel to a better area, it was totally fine. Couldn't have asked for a better location for people who would be using the train to go see different areas of the city. A quick walk to the Art Institute and Millenium Park too. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: stlsmiles
Reviews.Content: If you want 5 star luxury then go pay the 5 star luxury prices. If you want something reasonable in the heart of downtown then this is for you! We were in walking distance to just about everything despite the weather (3/19/10-3/21/10)...restaurants, bars, theatres, shopping. Taxis were always readily available if needed for further away tourist type stuff and would definitely recommend you use them or other public transport as you will pay and arm & a leg to park pretty much everywhere. Yes, the rooms are on the smaller side and there is no iron in the room, but what a GREAT use of space, modern ammenities and the 'community closet' is well equipped with the iron and ironing board. If something was needed that was not in the closet, we called the front desk and received it with in 5-10 minutes if that long. They do start with the minimum...if you're staying two to a room then you get two pillows, two towels, etc. However, if you need anything the staff is on it. The staff was VERY knowledgeable and VERY helpful with everything we needed and wanted. Really can't say enough about the staff...GREAT JOB TO YOU ALL!! Overall, we definitely got what we paid for and beyond. We will definitely be staying here again on future visits to the Windy City!!

Reviews.Title: “A great view and location”
Reviews.Author: muchlivingtodo
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters is geared toward the business traveler. Efficiency sized, with a nice desk area complete with extra electrical outlets. Clean and comfortable, the view out the 18th floor of the city is great. The free water became our favorite amenity. Free laundry facilities complete with soap are offered as well. The shower is simple, but adequate. We spent 3 nights here and had no complaints. I will stress the room is smaller than most, but we have stayed in smaller rooms in Europe. Our location is key in a large city and Club Quarters fit perfectly. Economical pricing afforded more experiences at the nearby sites. Although we did not partake, a minimal $2.50 service charge for delivery of dinner to your room from outside source (in binder) seemed like a nice perk. There are plenty of dining choices from mid to upscale and coffee just next door, if you enjoy a particular brew. If you travel a lot, tend to plan to be out of the room more than in, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ttonetom
Reviews.Content: Small kitchenette, comfortable bed. The room was very clean and the location couldn't be beat. Price was lower than most.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jheyen
Reviews.Content: There was a large conference in town and had to get a hotel at the last minute. Used priceline and won the hotel for a great price. The room I got had a kitchenette and was nicely sized, larger than what I was expecting. The rooms were very much updated and in style, clean and overall very good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great view”
Reviews.Author: SMFToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: We had an upper floor with a great view. Room was clean, nice and quiet. Only three rooms on the floor. Free water was great as was the free internet. Good security. We really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Milleens
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters on Wacker Drive would be my first choice on a return visit to Chicago. The hotel is really well located. The bus stop for the trolley tour is literally straight across the road and if you want to take a river boat tour (which I would highly recommend), you simply have to go down the steps to the river from there. It's right on the magnificent mile so you don't have to walk too far with heavy shopping bags. I booked this hotel very late (about a week before my planned trip) and while all the other hotels were extortionately expensive, this one was not nearly as bad (relatively speaking). The hotel has valet parking which costs around $26 a night, if I recall correctly. I booked the smallest available room which I think was the club size room. This room is quite small but by no means the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. In fact, it was definitely just the right size for me. I was only travelling with an overnight bag and I think if I had a large suitcase, the room might have been too small. I would recommend that a couple travelling with 2 suitcases take a larger room. The room was immaculately clean and the bed was so comfortable. I can honestly say I've never had such a good night's sleep in a hotel. Considering the location, I was expecting the room to be noisy but I had no problems whatsoever in that regard. There are open access computers in the lobby and there are even printing facilities there so that people can check-in for flights online and print their boarding cards. Overall, I was really happy with my choice of this hotel and there is no question about where I will be staying when I go back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jetb007
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were given a free upgrade to a suite. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. For the price we paid you couldn't beat the value and location. I would definitely recommend to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Ativan1
Reviews.Content: We booked this on priceline. If you read lnphantom's review, it sounds like they booked on priceline too. Priceline gets you one room with a bed, if you want to fit four in a room don't be a cheap..... and put two people in two rooms. We booked on priceline and would love to stay here again. We stayed at the Intercontinental last month, and I have to say despite the smaller rooms i would prefer club quarters over them. The rooms are very quiet and clean. The location is great, just a short walk from the L and half block from Michigan. They let you have free bottled water. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small, but hey, when I am in Chicago i only sleep in them anyway. I slept very good while there. The free use of the computers is very helpful also. You can check in and print off your flight passes. There are some nice eating places nearby. Give them a try but don't expect a huge room. It is more of the European sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - know what you get with Club Quarters”
Reviews.Author: BlackStar926
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Club Quarters. It was no Sheraton which is down 2 blocks down and gorgeous decor, but they Club Quarters was functional, clean, and they did not nickel and dime you like larger hotel chains. I checked in via a computer (with staff helping me) and it was very easy. There were upgrades avail to go to a suite level for $15 but I stuck to my simple room. It was small. Good enough for one person. The room had a large shower with shower curtain - no tub. They had free internet in the rooms and brought me an ethernet cord for my laptop whose wireless card is not very good. They have a filtered water system in the hallways and empty waterbottles for every guest to help themselves. Usually internet is $10-$15 a day and water is $5 - $7 a bottle. I just really like how this hotel included it all for free! I did not check out the gym, but know it was included as well as a lounge and business area. Great location off of N Wacker. For business travelers I highly reccommend. If you are going to Chicago for vacation, I would get a larger room. For the price you pay, I was very impressed with the Club Quarters and will stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Club Quarters Wacker Dr Chgo---Great Value Great Security”
Reviews.Author: GolightlyPHX
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 7 nights @ Club Quarters on Wacker Dr in Chicago. Beautiful Views & Great Location Yes the rooms are small but very clean, the staff was extremely friendly, the security was great and the convenience of guest amenities (free water, ironing board, coffee supplies) was abundant and easy to access. Did experience Internet problems but it was fixed. Fantastic views of Trump Tower & Marina City and the Chicago River. Easy access to all public transportation and easy walking distance to many of the cities best features. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Bioko
Reviews.Content: We booked a double in order to share rooms. When checking in however, we were given a queen and had to go down to the lobby again to complain for getting what we had ordered. The staff was not particularly helpful (asking why we could not sleep together in the queen) but in the end gave us a double. Just a side note: they did not mention the 15$ surcharge for the second person until we checked out. The room was pretty standard, nice but a little small. We had a very nice view over the river. What was particularly cool is that they offer filtered water on each floor. Service however was really poor. Towels were not replaced, soap and shower gel had to be ordered on the phone because not even empty bottles were replaced by the staff. There is a complimentary laundry (washing machine and dryer) in the basement. However, there was no detergent. After calling the reception and asking for some, the promised it right away. It took us about an hour to get the detergent in the end. The last thing was the internet. There is wifi in the rooms but it is so incredibly slow and unreliable that we could not really use it at all. A plus though is the fact that it is possible to print documents from your laptop for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Shtirlits
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a great choice if you don't want to spend $$$ for staying in an upscale hotel. The location is perfect. In fact, it couldn't be better. The hotel is located on the river, across from Wrigley building. The hotel is in a nice building, constructed in 1920's. Staff is very professional and friendly. Rooms are not fancy, but clean and are far from basic. My wife enjoyed down duvet. Free bottles of filtered water is a nice touch. Ask for the rooms with river view. It's amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Unacceptable!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lnphantom
Reviews.Content: My husband (then fiance) and I spent a weekend in Chicago with some friends. We booked a hotel on a third party website where you do not find out what hotel you booked until after it is booked. We had never been to Club Quarters, and after our terrible experience, we will NEVER be back!!! My husband called the hotel several times at least a week before we arrived to make sure our room could accommodate four people. He was assured that it could. Once we arrived, we were told that four people in our room would violate fire code, so we were being moved to a larger room. We were then made to pay extra for this "upgrade." The Room This was one of the worst rooms I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed in some holes. The room was clean, but that was the only positive thing about it. The room contained one bed that would probably be too small for a 12 year old boy. The mattress was rock hard, and the blanket was thinner than Kate Moss. My husband and I took the bed (more of a sacrifice than a privilege!), and our friend slept on the sleeper sofa. It was extremely dangerous, for it would spontaneously fold up and its springs poked through the barely there mattress. We asked for a rollaway mattress for my friend's sister, but there was not enough room for it. We did use the mattress from it to try to make the sleeper sofa more comfortable, but it did little to no good. My friend's sister ended up sleeping UNDER THE DESK on an air mattress we had (the most comfortable thing in the room!) The room was incredibly small, so we had to literally jump from mattress to mattress to get to the bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom, the door did not lock, the shower curtain was useless, it had no exhaust fan, and there was no bathtub (we were desperate enough to sleep in the bathtub had there been one). The room did have a television, but the picture was always fuzzy, and we had to mess with the cable in order to get any channels. The Staff The staff is what made our stay go from a bad dream to a nightmare. I do not think anyone who works at the hotel is capable intelligence. The staff was EXTREMELY rude and confrontational, blaming US for the hotel's incompetence. We asked repeatedly to speak to a manager, and we were always given the run a round. After one night, we wanted to leave, but we were told we could not get a refund unless we talked to the person who does the reservations for the hotel...IN NEW YORK!!!! We called this person in New York repeatedly who was also rude. In order to get a refund, we would have had to hire a lawyer. The Lies The staff lied to us repeatedly. When we complained about our room, we were told we would be moved to a new room. This never happened. We asked for extra blankets and pillows, and we were told the staff would bring us some. This never happened. We called at least three times before being told the hotel had run out of blankets and pillows. The same thing happened when we asked for more towels (there was only ONE set of towels in the room). Other Issues There were only 2 elevators, so we had to wait a LONG time to get anywhere. Our room key also worked sometimes and did not work at other times. Overall This was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. Not only was the room terrible, but the staff seemed to take pleasure in our discomfort. They should all be fired. I travel a lot, and I am a very laid back person who rarely complains, but the truth must be told about Club Quarters in Chicago. The word on the trash cans in the hall sums up this hotel...RUBBISH!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Anwen
Reviews.Content: Had read some less than favourable reviews so was concerned about the hotel. However, it was wonderful. I was in a corner room on the 23rd floor, great view of the river. The rooms are small but not tiny, perfectly fine for one or two people. The bed was extremely comfortable, updated bathroom, mini-fridge and microwave, heard no noise from other rooms, free wi-fi - I didn't have my laptop so I don't know what the connection was like. There are two PCs with a printer in the Lobby area that you can use for free. The staff were friendly and very helpful. On each floor is a water dispenser with bottles so you don't have to pay for overpriced bottled water from the 7-11. We ate in the hotel restaurant one night and the food and service were excellent. The location is great, right on the river, close to Michigan Ave, within walking distance of so much. We didn't realise that the city bus [$2.25] to the Science & Industry Museum stops right by the hotel, we paid for a taxi because it was raining the one day but came back on the bus.

HotelInfo.Name: Club Quarters Chicago -- Wacker at Michigan
HotelInfo.Address: 75 East Wacker Drive, Chicago, IL 60601
